meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

spec.documentation: The new virtual service specification to apply. This overwrites the existing data.

virtualServiceName.documentation: The name of the virtual service to update.

route.documentation: A full description of the route that was updated.

weightedTargets.documentation: An object that represents the targets that traffic is routed to when a request matches the route.

HttpRouteAction.documentation: An object that represents the action to take if a match is determined.

limit.documentation: The maximum number of results returned by ListRoutes in paginated output. When you use this parameter, ListRoutes returns only limit results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. You can see the remaining results of the initial request by sending another ListRoutes request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 100. If you don't use this parameter, ListRoutes returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value if applicable.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to list routes in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nextToken.documentation: The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListRoutes request where limit was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value.

virtualRouterName.documentation: The name of the virtual router to list routes in.

arn.documentation: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the virtual service.

createdAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was last updated.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the virtual service resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

resourceOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the resource owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the mesh owner or of another account that the mesh is shared with. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

version.documentation: The version of the resource. Resources are created at version 1, and this version is incremented each time that they're updated.

VirtualServiceRef.documentation: An object that represents a virtual service returned by a list operation.

idle.documentation: An object that represents an idle timeout. An idle timeout bounds the amount of time that a connection may be idle. The default value is none.

perRequest.documentation: An object that represents a per request timeout. The default value is 15 seconds. If you set a higher timeout, then make sure that the higher value is set for each App Mesh resource in a conversation. For example, if a virtual node backend uses a virtual router provider to route to another virtual node, then the timeout should be greater than 15 seconds for the source and destination virtual node and the route.

GrpcTimeout.documentation: An object that represents types of timeouts.

status.documentation: The current status of the virtual node.

VirtualNodeStatus.documentation: An object that represents the current status of the virtual node.

arn.documentation: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the virtual router.

createdAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was last updated.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the virtual router resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

resourceOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the resource owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the mesh owner or of another account that the mesh is shared with. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

version.documentation: The version of the resource. Resources are created at version 1, and this version is incremented each time that they're updated.

VirtualRouterRef.documentation: An object that represents a virtual router returned by a list operation.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the virtual service resides in.

status.documentation: The current status of the virtual service.

VirtualServiceData.documentation: An object that represents a virtual service returned by a describe operation.

invert.documentation: Specify True to match anything except the match criteria. The default value is False.

name.documentation: A name for the HTTP header in the client request that will be matched on.

HttpRouteHeader.documentation: An object that represents the HTTP header in the request.

arn.documentation: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the virtual node.

createdAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was last updated.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the virtual node resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

resourceOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the resource owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the mesh owner or of another account that the mesh is shared with. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

version.documentation: The version of the resource. Resources are created at version 1, and this version is incremented each time that they're updated.

VirtualNodeRef.documentation: An object that represents a virtual node returned by a list operation.

clientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Up to 36 letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.

meshName.documentation: The name to use for the service mesh.

tags.documentation: Optional metadata that you can apply to the service mesh to assist with categorization and organization. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

weightedTargets.documentation: An object that represents the targets that traffic is routed to when a request matches the route.

GrpcRouteAction.documentation: An object that represents the action to take if a match is determined.

certificateChain.documentation: The certificate trust chain for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

VirtualGatewayTlsValidationContextFileTr.documentation: An object that represents a Transport Layer Security (TLS) validation context trust for a local file.

LimitExceededException.documentation: You have exceeded a service limit for your account. For more information, see Service Limits in the AWS App Mesh User Guide.

exact.documentation: The value sent by the client must match the specified value exactly.

prefix.documentation: The value sent by the client must begin with the specified characters.

range.documentation: An object that represents the range of values to match on.

regex.documentation: The value sent by the client must include the specified characters.

suffix.documentation: The value sent by the client must end with the specified characters.

GrpcRouteMetadataMatchMethod.documentation: An object that represents the match method. Specify one of the match values.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the virtual service resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

virtualServiceName.documentation: The name of the virtual service to describe.

key.documentation: The name of an AWS Cloud Map service instance attribute key. Any AWS Cloud Map service instance that contains the specified key and value is returned.

value.documentation: The value of an AWS Cloud Map service instance attribute key. Any AWS Cloud Map service instance that contains the specified key and value is returned.

AwsCloudMapInstanceAttribute.documentation: An object that represents the AWS Cloud Map attribute information for your virtual node.

provider.documentation: The App Mesh object that is acting as the provider for a virtual service. You can specify a single virtual node or virtual router.

VirtualServiceSpec.documentation: An object that represents the specification of a virtual service.

certificateAuthorityArns.documentation: One or more ACM Amazon Resource Name (ARN)s.

VirtualGatewayTlsValidationContextAcmTru.documentation: An object that represents a TLS validation context trust for an AWS Certicate Manager (ACM) certificate.

file.documentation: The file object to send virtual gateway access logs to.

VirtualGatewayAccessLog.documentation: The access log configuration for a virtual gateway.

MatchRange.documentation: An object that represents the range of values to match on. The first character of the range is included in the range, though the last character is not. For example, if the range specified were 1-100, only values 1-99 would be matched.

action.documentation: The action to take if a match is determined.

timeout.documentation: An object that represents types of timeouts.

TcpRoute.documentation: An object that represents a TCP route type.

virtualGateway.documentation: A full description of the virtual gateway that was updated.

limit.documentation: The maximum number of results returned by ListVirtualRouters in paginated output. When you use this parameter, ListVirtualRouters returns only limit results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. You can see the remaining results of the initial request by sending another ListVirtualRouters request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 100. If you don't use this parameter, ListVirtualRouters returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value if applicable.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to list virtual routers in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nextToken.documentation: The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListVirtualRouters request where limit was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value.

limit.documentation: The maximum number of results returned by ListVirtualServices in paginated output. When you use this parameter, ListVirtualServices returns only limit results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. You can see the remaining results of the initial request by sending another ListVirtualServices request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 100. If you don't use this parameter, ListVirtualServices returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value if applicable.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to list virtual services in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nextToken.documentation: The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListVirtualServices request where limit was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value.

file.documentation: The file object to send virtual node access logs to.

AccessLog.documentation: An object that represents the access logging information for a virtual node.

limit.documentation: The maximum number of results returned by ListVirtualNodes in paginated output. When you use this parameter, ListVirtualNodes returns only limit results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. You can see the remaining results of the initial request by sending another ListVirtualNodes request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 100. If you don't use this parameter, ListVirtualNodes returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value if applicable.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to list virtual nodes in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nextToken.documentation: The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListVirtualNodes request where limit was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value.

tls.documentation: A reference to an object that represents a Transport Layer Security (TLS) client policy.

VirtualGatewayClientPolicy.documentation: An object that represents a client policy.

TooManyRequestsException.documentation: The maximum request rate permitted by the App Mesh APIs has been exceeded for your account. For best results, use an increasing or variable sleep interval between requests.

virtualService.documentation: An object that represents a virtual service gateway route target.

GatewayRouteTarget.documentation: An object that represents a gateway route target.

Duration.documentation: An object that represents a duration of time.

headers.documentation: An object that represents the client request headers to match on.

method.documentation: The client request method to match on. Specify only one.

prefix.documentation: Specifies the path to match requests with. This parameter must always start with /, which by itself matches all requests to the virtual service name. You can also match for path-based routing of requests. For example, if your virtual service name is my-service.local and you want the route to match requests to my-service.local/metrics, your prefix should be /metrics.

scheme.documentation: The client request scheme to match on. Specify only one.

HttpRouteMatch.documentation: An object that represents the requirements for a route to match HTTP requests for a virtual router.

key.documentation: One part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A key is a general label that acts like a category for more specific tag values.

value.documentation: The optional part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A value acts as a descriptor within a tag category (key).

TagRef.documentation: Optional metadata that you apply to a resource to assist with categorization and organization. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

arn.documentation: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service mesh.

createdAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was last updated.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

resourceOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the resource owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the mesh owner or of another account that the mesh is shared with. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

version.documentation: The version of the resource. Resources are created at version 1, and this version is incremented each time that they're updated.

MeshRef.documentation: An object that represents a service mesh returned by a list operation.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh.

metadata.documentation: The associated metadata for the service mesh.

spec.documentation: The associated specification for the service mesh.

MeshData.documentation: An object that represents a service mesh returned by a describe operation.

gatewayRoute.documentation: The full description of your gateway route following the create call.

status.documentation: The current status of the virtual router.

VirtualRouterStatus.documentation: An object that represents the status of a virtual router.

weightedTargets.documentation: An object that represents the targets that traffic is routed to when a request matches the route.

TcpRouteAction.documentation: An object that represents the action to take if a match is determined.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to delete the virtual gateway from.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

virtualGatewayName.documentation: The name of the virtual gateway to delete.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the virtual node resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

virtualNodeName.documentation: The name of the virtual node to describe.

RouteStatus.documentation: An object that represents the current status of a route.

healthCheck.documentation: The health check information for the listener.

portMapping.documentation: The port mapping information for the listener.

timeout.documentation: An object that represents timeouts for different protocols.

tls.documentation: A reference to an object that represents the Transport Layer Security (TLS) properties for a listener.

Listener.documentation: An object that represents a listener for a virtual node.

action.documentation: An object that represents the action to take if a match is determined.

match.documentation: An object that represents the criteria for determining a request match.

retryPolicy.documentation: An object that represents a retry policy.

timeout.documentation: An object that represents types of timeouts.

GrpcRoute.documentation: An object that represents a gRPC route type.

enforce.documentation: Whether the policy is enforced. The default is True, if a value isn't specified.

ports.documentation: One or more ports that the policy is enforced for.

validation.documentation: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context.

ClientPolicyTls.documentation: An object that represents a Transport Layer Security (TLS) client policy.

acm.documentation: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context trust for an AWS Certicate Manager (ACM) certificate.

file.documentation: An object that represents a TLS validation context trust for a local file.

VirtualGatewayTlsValidationContextTrust.documentation: An object that represents a Transport Layer Security (TLS) validation context trust.

virtualNodeName.documentation: The name of the virtual node that is acting as a service provider.

VirtualNodeServiceProvider.documentation: An object that represents a virtual node service provider.

action.documentation: An object that represents the action to take if a match is determined.

match.documentation: An object that represents the criteria for determining a request match.

HttpGatewayRoute.documentation: An object that represents an HTTP gateway route.

clientPolicy.documentation: A reference to an object that represents a client policy.

BackendDefaults.documentation: An object that represents the default properties for a backend.

privateKey.documentation: The private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

ListenerTlsFileCertificate.documentation: An object that represents a local file certificate. The certificate must meet specific requirements and you must have proxy authorization enabled. For more information, see Transport Layer Security (TLS).

httpRetryEvents.documentation:
Specify at least one of the following values.

  • server-error – HTTP status codes 500, 501, 502, 503, 504, 505, 506, 507, 508, 510, and 511

  • gateway-error – HTTP status codes 502, 503, and 504

  • client-error – HTTP status code 409

  • stream-error – Retry on refused stream

perRetryTimeout.documentation: An object that represents a duration of time.

HttpRetryPolicy.documentation: An object that represents a retry policy. Specify at least one value for at least one of the types of RetryEvents, a value for maxRetries, and a value for perRetryTimeout.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the virtual router resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

virtualRouterName.documentation: The name of the virtual router to describe.

TooManyTagsException.documentation: The request exceeds the maximum allowed number of tags allowed per resource. The current limit is 50 user tags per resource. You must reduce the number of tags in the request. None of the tags in this request were applied.

clientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Up to 36 letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.

gatewayRouteName.documentation: The name of the gateway route to update.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the gateway route resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

spec.documentation: The new gateway route specification to apply. This overwrites the existing data.

virtualGatewayName.documentation: The name of the virtual gateway that the gateway route is associated with.

limit.documentation: The maximum number of results returned by ListVirtualGateways in paginated output. When you use this parameter, ListVirtualGateways returns only limit results in a single page along with a nextToken response element. You can see the remaining results of the initial request by sending another ListVirtualGateways request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 100. If you don't use this parameter, ListVirtualGateways returns up to 100 results and a nextToken value if applicable.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to list virtual gateways in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

nextToken.documentation: The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListVirtualGateways request where limit was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value.

certificateChain.documentation: The certificate trust chain for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

TlsValidationContextFileTrust.documentation: An object that represents a Transport Layer Security (TLS) validation context trust for a local file.

invert.documentation: Specify True to match anything except the match criteria. The default value is False.

match.documentation: An object that represents the data to match from the request.

GrpcRouteMetadata.documentation: An object that represents the match metadata for the route.

clientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Up to 36 letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to create the route in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then the account that you specify must share the mesh with your account before you can create the resource in the service mesh. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

routeName.documentation: The name to use for the route.

tags.documentation: Optional metadata that you can apply to the route to assist with categorization and organization. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

virtualRouterName.documentation: The name of the virtual router in which to create the route. If the virtual router is in a shared mesh, then you must be the owner of the virtual router resource.

TcpTimeout.documentation: An object that represents types of timeouts.

gatewayRouteName.documentation: The name of the gateway route to delete.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to delete the gateway route from.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

virtualGatewayName.documentation: The name of the virtual gateway to delete the route from.

clientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Up to 36 letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the route resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

routeName.documentation: The name of the route to update.

spec.documentation: The new route specification to apply. This overwrites the existing data.

virtualRouterName.documentation: The name of the virtual router that the route is associated with.

action.documentation: An object that represents the action to take if a match is determined.

match.documentation: An object that represents the criteria for determining a request match.

retryPolicy.documentation: An object that represents a retry policy.

timeout.documentation: An object that represents types of timeouts.

HttpRoute.documentation: An object that represents an HTTP or HTTP/2 route type.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh to describe.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

arn.documentation: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource.

createdAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the resource was last updated.

meshName.documentation: The name of the service mesh that the resource resides in.

meshOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the service mesh owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the account that shared the mesh with your account. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

resourceOwner.documentation: The AWS IAM account ID of the resource owner. If the account ID is not your own, then it's the ID of the mesh owner or of another account that the mesh is shared with. For more information about mesh sharing, see Working with shared meshes.

version.documentation: The version of the resource. Resources are created at version 1, and this version is incremented each time that they're updated.

VirtualGatewayRef.documentation: An object that represents a virtual gateway returned by a list operation.

egressFilter.documentation: The egress filter rules for the service mesh.

MeshSpec.documentation: An object that represents the specification of a service mesh.

virtualGateway.documentation: The full description of your virtual gateway.

gatewayRoute.documentation: The full description of your gateway route.

nextToken.documentation: The nextToken value to include in a future ListTagsForResource request. When the results of a ListTagsForResource request exceed limit, you can use this value to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

awsCloudMap.documentation: Specifies any AWS Cloud Map information for the virtual node.

dns.documentation: Specifies the DNS information for the virtual node.

ServiceDiscovery.documentation: An object that represents the service discovery information for a virtual node.

nextToken.documentation: The nextToken value to include in a future ListVirtualNodes request. When the results of a ListVirtualNodes request exceed limit, you can use this value to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

virtualNodes.documentation: The list of existing virtual nodes for the specified service mesh.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to delete tags from.

tagKeys.documentation: The keys of the tags to be removed.

certificateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate. The certificate must meet specific requirements and you must have proxy authorization enabled. For more information, see Transport Layer Security (TLS).

ListenerTlsAcmCertificate.documentation: An object that represents an AWS Certicate Manager (ACM) certificate.
